entry.title: Reland "overview: Fix a rounded corner issue with tablet mode"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 08e460691f1e6de2b7432b527c71f0de94553643.

Fix is between ps1 & ps2. This makes the immersive title bar

animation respect non zero duration.



Original change's description:

> overview: Fix a rounded corner issue with tablet mode

>

> There are two separate issues:

> - Header view is now painted, so it doesn't need a scale to undo the

> window transform.

> - In one snap + overview, preview view has a clip and transform that

> is not accounted for.

>

> This CL adds a quick fix for the first issue and adds a pixel test for

> future fixes.

entry.title: Fix LocalFrame::LoadJavaScriptURL() to use origin instead of URL.
entry.content:
Previously, LocalFrame::LoadJavaScriptURL() only checked the current

document URL's scheme to see if JavaScript URLs should be blocked on

privileged pages like chrome:// or chrome-extension://. This

doesn't work if a privileged page opens an about:blank popup, where

the origin is inherited but the URL's scheme is "about". Fix this

check to use the origin instead.



The same bug is also possible if the popup is sandboxed, and in that

case the check should consider the precursor origin. Tests

are added for both the normal and sandboxed popup cases.

entry.title: ImageProcessorFactory: Optimize duplicated create logic.
entry.content:
Previously the ImageProcessorFactory had 2 separate external functions

for setting up and creating an ImageProcessor; namely the |Create| and

|CreateWithInputCandidates| functions.



Updates the ImageProcessorFactory to add optional PortConfig arguments

to the |CreateWithInputCandidates| function. The function is updated to

behave like the original |Create| function if the PortConfig arguments

are specified. The ImageProcessorClient was also updated to call the

|CreateWithInputCandidates| function for ImageProcessor creation.



Ran on a Brya board.

entry.title: [Tab Group UI] Make TabGridDialogController init lazy
entry.content:
Restore the lazy nature of the TabGridDialogController initialization.

This regressed in: crrev.com/1127368



Originally this code used a Supplier with

1. `get()` overridden to lazily perform one-time init on first call.

2. `hasValue()` overridden to check if the object initialized in `get()`

was ready yet.



`hasValue()` was then used to guard `get()` calls where initialization

of the object via `get()` was not immediately required creating a lazy

supplier.



The regression was caused by replacing `Supplier` with

`OneshotSupplierImpl` which was not aware of `hasValue()` being a guard

for `get()`. As a result, when `onAvailable()` was invoked `get()` was

called immediately turning the lazy initialization into eager

initialization.



This CL introduces LazyOneshotSupplier which requires clients to

override `doSet()`. `doSet()` should call `set(T)` and will be invoked

in `get()` if `hasValue()` is false. Other changes include:

* `hasValue()` is a proxy for whether the promise is fulfilled.

* `onAvailable()` only invokes `get()` if `hasValue()` is true.



Bug: 1480970

Change-Id: Ia4278393b8500e287125c3adda8c9f393e1a20ce

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4851426

Reviewed-by: Theresa Sullivan

Commit-Queue: Calder Kitagawa

Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

entry.title: Add password auth view
entry.content:
This CL adds implementation for `password_auth_view`, which is a

subclass of `factor_auth_view` in the `auth_panel` code. The state

for `password_auth_view` lives in the `auth_factor_store`, which handles

storing the state and processing state transitions. `password_auth_view`

itself only takes care of UI logic.



Future CL would cover implementing the timers for the password field, as

well as integration with `auth_panel` and a new feature flag to hide the

entirety of the `auth_panel` code behind for toggling between new and

old implementations.

timing causing an integer overflow crash (self.items.count - 1 when

is caused by the impossible memory allocation).



This CL adds a workaround when this happens.

entry.title: Smart GPU fence handle
entry.content:
The purpose of this change is to avoid the duplication (and then later

closing) of file handles for fences that reside in the same process.



By default this change is only enabled for lacros but should be

finched for all platforms that use fds for fences.



This change is potentially risky as it might cause a fence to be

invalid/empty for cases of wrong GPUFenceHandle usage. This usage

would be pointer/reference retention instead of by value.

entry.title: IndexedDB: fix crasher in transaction commit race.
entry.content:
This patch contains a prospective fix for the linked bug in

TransactionImpl. The hypothesis is that the transaction has already

been aborted when the quota response returns (see moved comment).

When a transaction is aborted, the handle to the bucket context is

released, hence this crasher. Before, IndexedDBTransaction would

have harmlessly invoked the copied tasks available callback.

entry.title: Emit janky frames during scrolls histogram separately in WebView
entry.content:
Android provides onFrameMetricsAvailable callback which provides

information whether a frame was janky as per Android or not. This change

makes use of that to identify janks during scrolls. This would also help

us make a more fairer scroll jank comparison between webview and chrome.

Our existing scroll jank metric isn't very comparable due to differences

in input and lack of presentation timestamps on webview.



Bug: b/298333696

Change-Id: I8745d3fdd68fbedde0e1832d994b1cb65fe27c1c

entry.title: Simplify PrefetchStreamingURLLoader lifetime
entry.content:
This CL makes `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` self-owned throughout

its lifetime, and deleted if and only if its prefetching

URLLoader is finished or canceled.



Notable changes:



This CL removes `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` lifetime/ownership

interactions in `PrefetchContainer::CreateRequestHandlerInternal()`.



This CL keeps only one `PrefetchContainer::streaming_loader_` WeakPtr

instead of vector of unique_ptrs,

because when switching `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader`s on redirects,

the old one can be scheduled for deletion before the new one starts.



After this CL, PrefetchContainer::IsPrefetchServable()

no longer checks `streaming_loader_`, because

otherwise it would return false once prefetching is completed.

Therefore, IsPrefetchServable() can return true even after serving.

This requires HasPrefetchBeenConsideredToServe() to be checked

in addition to IsPrefetchServable() when serving.



This CL adds a comment about requiring

`Reader::HaveDefaultContextCookiesChanged()` to be checked

in addition to IsPrefetchServable() when serving,

which is an existing requirement.



This CL renames `ResetAllStreamingURLLoaders()` into

`CancelStreamingURLLoaderIfNotServing()` and refactors it.

This clarifies when `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader` is canceled

from `PrefetchContainer`, and its possibly problematic cases,

while this CL itself leaves the problematic cases as-is.



To reduce the impact of `ResetAllStreamingURLLoaders()` issues,

this CL removes `ResetAllStreamingURLLoaders()` calls

- From `PrefetchService::OnPrefetchResponseCompleted()`,

because `DisconnectPrefetchURLLoaderMojo()` should be already

called from `PrefetchStreamingURLLoader::OnComplete()`.

- From `HandleRedirect(kFail)` callsites, and instead calls

`DisconnectPrefetchURLLoaderMojo()` inside `HandleRedirect()`.

These clears `streaming_loader_` asynchronously,

but I expect this doesn't impact the behavior.



`timeout_timer_.AbandonAndStop()` is moved to

DisconnectPrefetchURLLoaderMojo().



Bug: 1449360

Change-Id: Ib2c49e8653f36947bdb4512c3748b4037e1f859d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4819763

entry.title: Hide placeholder thumbnails for discarded tabs in hovercards
entry.content:
If a thumbnail image hasn't been captured for a tab before it was

discarded, then we will never capture a thumbnail till the page

is reloaded. For that reason, it doesn't make sense to show the

placeholder which might make it seem like a thumbnail will appear

if the user waits.

entry.content:
Case #1: getComputedName/Role should update the tree via the normal process, and then return the resulting AXObject for the node.



Case #2: HandleEventSubscriptionChanged() was calling

DetermineAccessibilityRole() to determine whether the role will be

changing. However, DetermineAccessibilityRole creates AXObjects in

tables to help determine the table role as it looks up the parent chain. Defer this work until clean layout.

entry.title: Only allow calling PersonalDataProfileTaskWaiter::Wait() on rvalues.
entry.content:
The function is only supposed to be called a single time per object.

Currently, this is enforced by tracking a boolean state. Instead,

since Wait() is the last function to called on the waiter, this CL

enforces that it's called on an rvalue. This way, the boolean is no

longer necessary.

This is what base::OnceCallback::Run() does as well.

entry.title: Fix wrong height when going fullscreen on Android
entry.content:
We changed from using KeyboardVisibilityDelegate.calculateKeyboardHeight

to cache getSystemWindowInsetBottom on onApplyWindowInsets

to calculate the IME height in https://crrev.com/c/4330441



Using getSystemWindowInsetBottom on onApplyWindowInsets will give out

undesired inset when going fullscreen

(because of the system UI animation,

it will overlap on the view and causing a falsy inset,

and then go back to 0)



And since we're adding this inset to counter out the view resizing,

we'll be setting a bigger height than the actuall screen height



This CL changes it back to

KeyboardVisibilityDelegate.calculateKeyboardHeight

but inside onApplyWindowInsets to make it reserve the original idea of

centralizing the inset code



Bug: 1464146, 1449230, 1446371, 1468554

settings callback would be cleared if settings were untrusted, causing

settings to never become trusted.

entry.title: Add PRESUBMIT rule about raw_ptrs and {}-style initialization.
entry.content:
The uniform initializer syntax `{}` is problematic for raw_ptr, as

its meaning is different than when used with T*. For the T* case, it

results in null initialization, but for the raw_ptr case, it results

in default constructor initialization. The default constructor may

leave the member uninitialized under the NoOpImpl, so using `{}` does

not result in the (presumably) intended null initialization.

entry.title: android: Rewrite ChildProcessConnection.bind
entry.content:
Previous implementation bugs when the first bindServiceConnection()

fails and returns false:

* calling retireBindingsAndBindFallback does not not bind any fallback

connections, because no connection was bound before hand. But it still

returns true

* in likely event that mWaivedBinding.bindServiceConnection() fails as

well, it trips an assert in updateBindingState().



Make the initial bind atomic wrt fallback so that all bindings are

retried after fallback. Also check bindServiceConnection result and only

update state after success. Bind mWaviedBinding only if initial binding

succeeds.



Bug: 1362040

Change-Id: Icff4ac7deb4cebd727bb2bba44711540f0bf8909

entry.title: Remove UIKit selection in TabGridModeSelection
entry.content:
When in TabGridModeSelection, we don't use the UICollectionView

selectioon/selected API. We use a custom array. This means that the

selected cell from TabGridModeNormal is still considered by UIKit as

selected when in TabGridModeSelection.

This is fine as it was ignored when displaying cells, but not when

interacting through VoiceOver, where the UIKit selection status was read

aloud before our custom selection status, leading to:

- "Selected, New Tab, Unselected".



This CL clears the UIKit selection when entering TabGridModeSelection.

The UIKit selection is reset already when leaving TabGridModeSelection.



Fixed: 1469864

entry.title: [//media] Move filling in VulkanYCbCrInfo from client- to service-side
entry.content:
VideoResourceUpdater currently constructs and sets VulkanYCbCrInfo on

TransferableResource for legacy multiplanar formats if it is not present

in the VideoFrame. This field is passed to ImageContextImpl on

construction on the service side, and it is used by

SkiaOutputSurfaceImpl as part of calculating the GrBackendFormat for the

texture.



VideoResourceUpdater should not need to have this knowledge/concern, as

SkiaOutputSurfaceImpl has all the information that it needs to construct

a missing VulkanYCbCrInfo on its side. This CL makes that change. Of

note, there are several callsites of GetGrBackendFormatForTexture().

Two of these callsites can be invoked with legacy multiplanar formats (

or with external sampling more generally); for these two callsites, we

can pass the ColorSpace that was obtained from the TransferableResource.

The other two callsites cannot be invoked with legacy multiplanar

formats/external sampling, as documented at those callsites in this CL.



There is no functional change in this CL. Followup will extend this

logic to handle multiplanar SI with external sampling and will

additionally do cleanup (making a util to construct the YcbCrInfo and

removing stale utils on the client side). More ambitious followup could

eliminate VideoFrame tracking YcbCrInfo entirely in favor of tracking

any information necessary for it to be always constructed on the

service-side when needed.



Bug: 1471111

Change-Id: Ie3295d69a87bdff49a7c6e68a1d07a63c009e310

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4853538

entry.title: [gpu] Disable Pixel_SVGHuge test on Win/Linux debug bots
entry.content:
The commit enabling the SmallerInterestArea config

(https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4856641) made

this test fail on some bots. This is because the test shrinks the

"interest area" from its default value of 3000 pixels down to 500,

matching one of the experiemntal groups.



This test renders a very complex SVG (>100k lines), scrolls it to an

offset, then back. See this code from pixel_svg_huge.html:



function scrollOutAndBack() {

requestAnimationFrame(() => {

window.scrollTo(1000, 1000);

requestAnimationFrame(() => {

window.scrollTo(0, 0);

requestAnimationFrame(() => {

sendResult("SUCCESS", "Test complete");

});

});

});

}



When the interest area is 3000 pixels, scrolling to the (1000, 1000)

pixels will not discard rasterized tiles for the initial viewport. Then

when scrolling back to the top left corner, no new raster task is

needed. However, when the interest area is set to 500 pixels, the

initial viewport tiles are discarded, and a new raster is needed when

coming back to the origin. This increases runtime by ~50% (from 2 to 3

raster tasks needed), making this heavy test (already disabled on a

variety of bots) fail.



Thus the "solution" is to disable this test on the failing bots. If the

experiment group ends up not shipping, it could be re-enabled.



Bug: 1459256, 1474637

Change-Id: I8d9a1bcfe3b8debd2b8ec24a5d61459c689d89f8

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4859179

Reviewed-by: Peter McNeeley

Commit-Queue: Benoit Lize

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1195411}

entry.title: cc: Prevent partial_update_dependents_ growth
entry.content:
Seems like `partial_update_dependents_` can grow unboundedly due to

entries that already destroyed. So clear out all destroyed reporters

instead of just the ones at the front to avoid this. Note this is now a

linear operation and was an amortized constant operation. Though there

is a max size of around kMaxOwnedPartialUpdateDependents = 300.

entry.title: Handle CSS @page margins correctly when scaling.
entry.content:
Let Blink handle the scale factor set in PrintParams. The PDF plug-in

already does this, but Blink didn't. Therefore there was logic in

PrintRenderFrameHelper to determine whether the scale factor should be

applied or not. This can now be removed, since everyone (i.e. PDF and

Blink) is now able to honor blink::WebPrintParams::scale_factor.



The only scaling that PrintRenderFrameHelper now needs to deal with, is

the fit-to-page scale factor, i.e. when the page size specified in CSS

is larger than actual paper.



Add a bunch of browser tests for this. Test coverage was/is really low!

Also test all three scaling mechanisms, when combined: PrintParams

scale, Blink scaling (to prevent inline overflow), and

PrintRenderFrameHelper fit-to-page scaling.



Bug: 1480270

entry.title: Support multiple clients per PrefetchResponseReader
entry.content:
This CL introduces code structure changes needed to serve

multiple URLLoaderClients per PrefetchResponseReader,

while keeping the existing behavior for single

URLLoaderClient case.



Upcoming CLs will actually allow multiple clients

(gated by feature flags).

As of this CL, `CreateRequestHandler()` can still be

called only once because it moves out `body_`.



This CL uses `ReceiverSet`, makes `event_queue_`

callbacks `RepeatingCallback`s, and adds `client_id`

arguments to event queue-related methods.



This CL forbids reentrancy around the event queue

(see the comment at `RunEventQueue()` declaration),

in order to simplify the logic.



Bug: 1449360

entry.title: [ios] Fix observation of active WebState in AdaptiveToolbarMediator
entry.content:
The recent refactoring of WebStateListObserver make it so that only

one event is sent to observers when a WebState is inserted in the

WebStateList with INSERT_ACTIVATE flag.



The implementation of the observer of AdaptiveToolbarMediator did

return early in the case where a batched operation before updating

the value of `self.webState` when if the insertion was done with

the INSERT_ACTIVATE flag (or when the active WebState was closed).



Fix this by changing early returns to `break` to ensure that the

code updating the `self.webState` property is properly called.



Remove obsolete TODO in `-setWebStateList:` and remove superfluous

call to `-setWebState:` (caused by setting `self.webState` to null

unconditionally).



Bug: 727427

Change-Id: Icf6fec8bd8a0a2002c1bea01e4b568ac14ab8157

entry.title: Take neighboring values for gradient color stops with missing parameters
entry.content:
https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/9295



I mistakenly thought earlier that missing parameters should resolve as

if that parameter were not there. In fact it should effectively become two stops in the same spot, taking non-missing parameters from

the left and right neighbors, respectively. If either neighbor is

missing then the parameter resolves to zero.



The test had to be updated.

entry.title: [iOS] Fix ManageSyncSettings when closing BulkUpload
entry.content:
When closing the BulkUpload view, the ManageSyncSettings model is

reloaded. This was an issue since `self.batchUploadItem` was still set.



While loading the table view model, the model is empty.



This patch updates `loadBatchUploadSection` to drop the current batch

upload item, and it calls `updateBatchUploadSection:NO` to create

the section if needed.



Also `fetchLocalDataDescriptionsForBatchUpload` method is created to

fetch the data descriptions and this method is called when the model

is loaded, and if there is any changes from the sync server or any

identity updates.



Fixed: 1481029

entry.title: Browsing Data Model: Add Unpartitioned storage deletion
entry.content:
Previously, the ability to delete only partitioned storage for a

specific [origin, site] combination was introduced the BDM.



This introduces the counterpart to that, the ability to only delete

_unpartitioned_ storage for an origin. Unpartitioned storage is all

types of kAPIs, non CHIPS cookies, as well as the 1P JS storage

partition (e.g. A on A).



This is required to continue to support the deletion semantics on the

all sites page which was introduced with CHIPS.



Bug: 1271155

entry.title: Restructure randomized-response logic
entry.content:
- Return both rate and response from one method on delegate: This

reduces 3 GetNumberOfStarsAndBarsSequences calls per source to 1.

- Perform channel-capacity check in delegate instead of storage: This

simplifies the storage code.

entry.title: Drop redundant SVG resource updates
entry.content:
Currently both LayoutObject::SetNeedsBoundariesUpdate() and the relevant

UpdateLayout() implementation for an SVG LayoutObject will mark the

object dirty if the "bounds" of it changes. The latter is slightly more

precise in general since it is performed in response to the LayoutObject

having had bounds changed. In the few cases where the UpdateLayout()

implementation doesn't handle it, apply the dirtying explicitly.

entry.title: Don't show context menu entries when Autofill is disabled.
entry.content:
Two Autofill-related context menu entries exist: Feedback and manual

fallbacks. Neither one should be shown when Autofill is disabled.

Currently, this is not the case, since the AutofillContextMenuManager

is called by the RenderViewContextMenu independently of any prefs.



This CL fixes this by checking for the pref before adding the context

menu entries. Since "Autofill is disabled" means different things for

the two features, this check cannot be done at a higher level (e.g.

not initializing the AutofillContextMenu manager at all). In particular:

- AutofillFeedback is shown when at least profile or payment Autofill

is enabled.

- Manual fallbacks are only shown if profile Autofill is enabled.

Payment methods already ignore unrecognized autocomplete attributes

and the feature only affects profiles.



Bug: 1407646, 1446318

Change-Id: Idea6aef8fa0f689eae3bf944a47f1ed1f7789363

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4856646

entry.title: gUM: Allow concurrent processed and unprocessed mic capture on CrOS
entry.content:
Currently, calling getUserMedia twice in sequence on CrOS with the following audio constraints will fail the second gUM call with an Overconstrained error:

1) {deviceId: {exact: 'default'}, echoCancellation: {exact: true},}

2) {deviceId: {exact: 'default'}, echoCancellation: {exact: false},}



...even though the underlying platform code supports this combination. This CL adds support for this to the constraints algorithm implementation.



The CL adding support at the platform layer was merged to M118:

https://crrev.com/c/4850007

Tested: manual test on CrOS + relevant pre-existing unit test



Bug: chromium:1481026, b/297495207
